properties.name: label
properties.description: label of a button

properties.name: prominent
properties.description: Prominent buttons are used for primary page-level actions, and should only be used once per page. Not all pages require a Prominent button. Use for call-to-actions, page navigation or process flows.

properties.name: subtle
properties.description: Outlined buttons are used for less prominent actions. They can be paired with Default or Primary buttons. They should be used sparingly by themselves.

properties.name: ghost
properties.description: Ghost buttons are available for when an additional level of hierarchy is needed. Ghost buttons have the smallest footprint, and should be used sparingly.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Tells if a button is disabled

properties.name: open
properties.description: Signifies whether dialog is open

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description: A DOMString providing a hint for a user agent's autocomplete feature.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads. Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Select description

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot interact with the control. If this attribute is not specified, the control inherits its setting from the containing element, for example `fieldset`; if there is no containing element with the disabled attribute set, then the control is enabled.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Tells if select has error

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: label
properties.description: Represents a caption for a select in a user interface

properties.name: id
properties.description: Custom select id

properties.name: name
properties.description: This attribute is used to specify the name of the control.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A string that provides a brief hint to the user as to what kind of information is expected in the field

properties.name: optionalLabel
properties.description: A label indicating that the field is optional

properties.name: selectedValue
properties.description: A way preselect a certain value. Have to equal the option `value` field.

properties.name: required
properties.description: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with a non-empty string value must be selected.

properties.name: optional
properties.description: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with may be skipped.

properties.name: options
properties.description: An array of options to populate <option> elements. Type: ISelectOption[].

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description: Space separated string that describes what, if any, type of autocomplete functionality the input should provide

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Automatically focus the form control when the page is loaded

properties.name: description
properties.description: Input description

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Tells if input is disabled

properties.name: error
properties.description: Tells if input has error

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: label
properties.description: Represents a caption for an input in a user interface

properties.name: id
properties.description: Custom input id

properties.name: min
properties.description: The most negative value in the range of permitted values

properties.name: max
properties.description: The greatest value in the range of permitted values

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: The minimum number of characters (as UTF-16 code units) the user can enter into the field

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: The maximum number of characters (as UTF-16 code units) the user can enter into the field

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name for the input control. This name is submitted along with the control's value when the form data is submitted

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A string that provides a brief hint to the user as to what kind of information is expected in the field

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: If present, indicates that the user should not be able to edit the value of the input

properties.name: required
properties.description: If present, indicates that the user must specify a value for the input before the owning form can be submitted

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specifies how much of the input is shown. Valid for email, password, tel, and text input types only. CSS width takes precedence over size attribute.

properties.name: step
properties.description: Valid for the numeric input types, including number, date/time input types, and range, the step attribute is a number that specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A string specifying the type of control to render.
